div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1124 Kerch' environs, Crimea oblast, Ukraine, before 1892 Burial: 125-100 B.C.? Contents: 10+ AR, "many" AE Panticapaeum: 8 dr. (as BMC 12) 2 hemidr. (head of Apollo- dolphin) "many" AE (as BMC 32-33 [ctmk. with tripod], 39 [the majority]) Disposition: Leningrad (the greater part, merged with main coll.) â€ Giel, Zapiski Russkogo Arkheologicheskogo Obsh- chestva, N.S. 5 (St. Petersburg, 1892), pp. 350-1 Zograph, p. 180, note (doubts that the AE belongs)
